        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The CDP protocol could lead to a list of Type confusion through the Crhome extension. <span class="line"><!---->The CDP protocol could lead to a list of Type confusion through the Crhome extension. <!----></span><br>Note that when change the js code in tt.html, it will produce different confusion. Here I only provide one example to trigger this.<span class="line"><!---->Note that when change the js code in tt.html, it will produce different confusion. Here I only provide one example to trigger this.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. unzip the poc.zip <span class="line"><!---->1. unzip the poc.zip <!----></span><br>2. cd to poc and run `python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605`<span class="line"><!---->2. cd to poc and run `python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605`<!----></span><br>3. ./chrome and load the extension in poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ./chrome and load the extension in poc<!----></span><br>4. crash<span class="line"><!---->4. crash<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>I get the trace with asan-linux-debug-838812<span class="line"><!---->I get the trace with asan-linux-debug-838812<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ../../v8/src/compiler/code-assembler.cc, line 1728<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ../../v8/src/compiler/code-assembler.cc, line 1728<!----></span><br># Type cast failed in CAST(LoadConstantPoolEntryAtOperandIndex(name_operand_index)) at ../../v8/src/interpreter/interpreter-generator.cc:181<span class="line"><!----># Type cast failed in CAST(LoadConstantPoolEntryAtOperandIndex(name_operand_index)) at ../../v8/src/interpreter/interpreter-generator.cc:181<!----></span><br>  Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899: [SharedFunctionInfo] in OldSpace<span class="line"><!---->  Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899: [SharedFunctionInfo] in OldSpace<!----></span><br> - map: 0x7ef7080425f5 <Map[40]><span class="line"><!----> - map: 0x7ef7080425f5 &lt;Map[40]&gt;<!----></span><br> - name: 0x7ef7080424f9 <String[0]: #><span class="line"><!----> - name: 0x7ef7080424f9 &lt;String[0]: #&gt;<!----></span><br> - inferred name: 0x7ef7080424f9 <String[0]: #><span class="line"><!----> - inferred name: 0x7ef7080424f9 &lt;String[0]: #&gt;<!----></span><br> - kind: NormalFunction<span class="line"><!----> - kind: NormalFunction<!----></span><br> - syntax kind: AnonymousExpression<span class="line"><!----> - syntax kind: AnonymousExpression<!----></span><br> - function_map_index: 161<span class="line"><!----> - expected_nof_properties: <!----></span><br> - language_mode: sloppy<span class="line"><!----> - language_mode: sloppy<!----></span><br> - data: 0x7ef70839e92d <BytecodeArray[2]><span         Thanks! Copying from the PDF:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! Copying from the PDF:<!----></span><br><br>This bug is probably caused by "bytecode confusion", while the constant pool is not changed.<span class="line"><!---->This bug is probably caused by "bytecode confusion", while the constant pool is not changed.<!----></span><br>For example, the bytecode of `console.log(1);` and `(function(){})();` are shown below.<span class="line"><!---->For example, the bytecode of `console.log(1);` and `(function(){})();` are shown below.<!----></span><br>In my poc, it run the bytecode of `console.log(1);` however, it use the constant pool of<span class="line"><!---->In my poc, it run the bytecode of `console.log(1);` however, it use the constant pool of<!----></span><br><br>`(function(){})();`<span class="line"><!---->`(function(){})();`<!----></span><br><br>The first Line `LdaGlobal [0], [0]` will get a name from `constant pool[0]`, which should be<span class="line"><!---->The first Line `LdaGlobal [0], [0]` will get a name from `constant pool[0]`, which should be<!----></span><br>"console" => however it use the wrong constant pool and get `<SharedFunctionInfo>`<span class="line"><!---->"console" =&gt; however it use the wrong constant pool and get `&lt;SharedFunctionInfo&gt;`<!----></span><br>Therefore, the Debug info says that `Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899:<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, the Debug info says that `Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899:<!----></span><br>[SharedFunctionInfo] in OldSpace`.<span           Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      yangguo@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1091219484" title="yangguo@chromium.org"><!---->yangguo@chromium.org<!----></a>
      yangguo@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->yangguo@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I'm not entirely sure whether we could rule out RCE if we have a type confusion where V8 might misinterpret an object in the constant pool. E.g. if a SharedFunctionInfo is misinterpreted as an ArrayBuffer. In that case I can imagine that an attacker could overwrite the function pointer to something arbitrary.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not entirely sure whether we could rule out RCE if we have a type confusion where V8 might misinterpret an object in the constant pool. E.g. if a SharedFunctionInfo is misinterpreted as an ArrayBuffer. In that case I can imagine that an attacker could overwrite the function pointer to something arbitrary.<!----></span><br><br>I still think the most cautious action is to disable LiveEdit.<span class="line"><!---->I still think the most cautious action is to disable LiveEdit.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          yangguo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          yangguo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Live edit isn't really implemented in the "interpreter" as such the interpreter just executes whatever bytecode it's given and if that's invalid, it's invalid. Liveedit is a separate tree/graph walk of post-compilation, mid-execution state that's currently sitting, afaict, somewhat unowned in the codebase. If we're worried about its security we should audit and harden it, but it's not clear who would own doing that. Assigning to yang for now for lack of a better owner.<span class="line"><!---->Live edit isn't really implemented in the "interpreter" as such the interpreter just executes whatever bytecode it's given and if that's invalid, it's invalid. Liveedit is a separate tree/graph walk of post-compilation, mid-execution state that's currently sitting, afaict, somewhat unowned in the codebase. If we're worried about its security we should audit and harden it, but it's not clear who would own doing that. Assigning to yang for now for lack of a better owner.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 42<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c42">Comment 42<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      yangguo@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3452531878" title="yangguo@google.com"><!---->yangguo@google.com<!----></a>
      yangguo@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->yangguo@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        for LitElement.

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1161459%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D5200" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1161459%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D5200%252526ust%25253D1703414284712975%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw32gB6UIIqWfXxH4NjjuvH5%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1161459: Security: Type confusion of V8 in extension debugger API
          <h1>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The CDP protocol could lead to a list of Type confusion through the Crhome extension. <span class="line"><!---->The CDP protocol could lead to a list of Type confusion through the Crhome extension. <!----></span><br>Note that when change the js code in tt.html, it will produce different confusion. Here I only provide one example to trigger this.<span class="line"><!---->Note that when change the js code in tt.html, it will produce different confusion. Here I only provide one example to trigger this.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. unzip the poc.zip <span class="line"><!---->1. unzip the poc.zip <!----></span><br>2. cd to poc and run `python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605`<span class="line"><!---->2. cd to poc and run `python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605`<!----></span><br>3. ./chrome and load the extension in poc<span class="line"><!---->3. ./chrome and load the extension in poc<!----></span><br>4. crash<span INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab]<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>I get the trace with         Thanks! Copying from the PDF:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! Copying from the PDF:<!----></span><br><br>This bug is probably caused by "bytecode confusion", while the constant pool is not changed.<span class="line"><!---->This bug is probably caused by "bytecode confusion", while the constant pool is not changed.<!----></span><br>For example, the bytecode of `console.log(1);` and `(function(){})();` are shown below.<span class="line"><!---->For example, the bytecode of `console.log(1);` and `(function(){})();` are shown below.<!----></span><br>In my poc, it run the bytecode of `console.log(1);` however, it use the constant pool of<span class="line"><!---->In my poc, it run the bytecode of `console.log(1);` however, it use the constant pool of<!----></span><br><br>`(function(){})();`<span class="line"><!---->`(function(){})();`<!----></span><br><br>The first Line `LdaGlobal [0], [0]` will get a name from `constant pool[0]`, which should be<span class="line"><!---->The first Line `LdaGlobal [0], [0]` will get a name from `constant pool[0]`, which should be<!----></span><br>"console" => however it use the wrong constant pool and get `<SharedFunctionInfo>`<span class="line"><!---->"console" =&gt; however it use the wrong constant pool and get `&lt;SharedFunctionInfo&gt;`<!----></span><br>Therefore, the Debug info says that `Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899:<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, the Debug info says that `Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899:<!----></span><br>[SharedFunctionInfo] in OldSpace`.<span class="line"><!---->[SharedFunctionInfo] in OldSpace`.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>d8> console.log(1);<span class="line"><!---->d8&gt; console.log(1);<!----></span><br>[generated bytecode for function: (0x7ef5082d3459 <SharedFunctionInfo>)]<span class="line"><!---->[generated bytecode for function: (0x7ef5082d3459 &lt;SharedFunctionInfo&gt;)]<!----></span><br>Parameter count 1<span class="line"><!---->Parameter count 1<!----></span><br>Register count 4<span class="line"><!---->Register count           Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      yangguo@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1091219484" title="yangguo@chromium.org"><!---->yangguo@chromium.org<!----></a>
      yangguo@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->yangguo@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I'm not entirely sure whether we could rule out RCE if we have a type confusion where V8 might misinterpret an object in the constant pool. E.g. if a SharedFunctionInfo is misinterpreted as an ArrayBuffer. In that case I can imagine that an attacker could overwrite the function pointer to something arbitrary.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not entirely sure whether we could rule out RCE if we have a type confusion where V8 might misinterpret an object in the constant pool. E.g. if a SharedFunctionInfo is misinterpreted as an ArrayBuffer. In that case I can imagine that an attacker could overwrite the function pointer to something arbitrary.<!----></span><br><br>I still think the most cautious action is to disable LiveEdit.<span class="line"><!---->I still think the most cautious action is to disable LiveEdit.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Yes. We haven't seen any crashes lately (after removing the Restart Frame feature) except for the non-linear memory behavior of LiveEdit, and developers use this feature a lot, so this needs to be fixed.<span class="line"><!---->Yes. We haven't seen any crashes lately (after removing the Restart Frame feature) except for the non-linear memory behavior of LiveEdit, and developers use this feature a lot, so this needs to be fixed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          yangguo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          yangguo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Live edit isn't really implemented in the "interpreter" as such the interpreter just executes whatever bytecode it's given and if that's invalid, it's invalid. Liveedit is a separate tree/graph walk of post-compilation, mid-execution state that's currently sitting, afaict, somewhat unowned in the codebase. If we're worried about its security we should audit and harden it, but it's not clear who would own doing that. Assigning to yang for now for lack of a better owner.<span class="line"><!---->Live edit isn't really implemented in the "interpreter" as such the interpreter just executes whatever bytecode it's given and if that's invalid, it's invalid. Liveedit is a separate tree/graph walk of post-compilation, mid-execution state that's currently sitting, afaict, somewhat unowned in the codebase. If we're worried about its security we should audit and harden it, but it's not clear who would own doing that. Assigning to yang for now for lack of a better owner.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          </div>
        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      merc....@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2374874189" title="merc....@gmail.com"><!---->merc....@gmail.com<!----></a>
      merc....@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->merc....@gmail.com<!----></span>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The CDP protocol could lead to a list of Type confusion through the Crhome extension. <span class="line"><!---->The CDP protocol could lead to a list of Type confusion through the Crhome extension. <!----></span><br>Note that when change the js code in tt.html, it will produce different confusion. Here I only provide one example to trigger this.<span class="line"><!---->Note that when change the js code in tt.html, it will produce different confusion. Here I only provide one example to trigger this.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: all<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: all<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. unzip the         Thanks! Copying from the PDF:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! Copying from the PDF:<!----></span><br><br>This bug is probably caused by "bytecode confusion", while the constant pool is not changed.<span class="line"><!---->This bug is probably caused by "bytecode confusion", while the constant pool is not changed.<!----></span><br>For example, the bytecode of `console.log(1);` and `(function(){})();` are shown below.<span class="line"><!---->For example, the bytecode of `console.log(1);` and `(function(){})();` are shown below.<!----></span><br>In my poc, it run the bytecode of `console.log(1);` however, it use the constant pool of<span class="line"><!---->In my poc, it run the bytecode of `console.log(1);` however, it use the constant pool of<!----></span><br><br>`(function(){})();`<span class="line"><!---->`(function(){})();`<!----></span><br><br>The first Line `LdaGlobal [0], [0]` will get a name from `constant pool[0]`, which should be<span class="line"><!---->The first Line `LdaGlobal [0], [0]` will get a name from `constant pool[0]`, which should be<!----></span><br>"console" => however it use the wrong constant pool and get `<SharedFunctionInfo>`<span class="line"><!---->"console" =&gt; however it use the wrong constant pool and get `&lt;SharedFunctionInfo&gt;`<!----></span><br>Therefore, the Debug info says that `Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899:<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, the Debug info says that `Expected Name but found 0x7ef70839e899:<!----></span><br>[SharedFunctionInfo] in OldSpace`.<span class="line"><!---->[SharedFunctionInfo] in OldSpace`.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>d8> console.log(1);<span class="line"><!---->d8&gt; console.log(1);<!----></span><br>[generated bytecode for function: (0x7ef5082d3459 <SharedFunctionInfo>)]<span class="line"><!---->[generated bytecode for function: (0x7ef5082d3459 &lt;SharedFunctionInfo&gt;)]<!----></span><br>Parameter count 1<span class="line"><!---->Parameter count 1<!----></span><br>Register count 4<span class="line"><!---->Register count 4<!----></span><br>Frame size 32<span class="line"><!---->Frame size 32<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34de @ 0 : 13 00 00 LdaGlobal [0], [0]<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34de @ 0 : 13 00 00 LdaGlobal [0], [0]<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34e1 @ 3 : 26 f8 Star r2<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34e1 @ 3 : 26 f8 Star r2<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34e3 @ 5 : 28 f8 01 02 LdaNamedProperty r2, [1], [2]<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34e3 @ 5 : 28 f8 01 02 LdaNamedProperty r2, [1], [2]<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34e7 @ 9 : 26 f9 Star r1<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34e7 @ 9 : 26 f9 Star r1<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34e9 @ 11 : 0c 01 LdaSmi [1]<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34e9 @ 11 : 0c 01 LdaSmi [1]<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34eb @ 13 : 26 f7 Star r3<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34eb @ 13 : 26 f7 Star r3<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34ed @ 15 : 5a f9 f8 f7 04 CallProperty1 r1, r2, r3, [4]<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34ed @ 15 : 5a f9 f8 f7 04 CallProperty1 r1, r2, r3, [4]<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34f2 @ 20 : 26 fa Star r0<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34f2 @ 20 : 26 fa Star r0<!----></span><br> 0x7ef5082d34f4 @ 22 : ab Return<span class="line"><!----> 0x7ef5082d34f4 @ 22 : ab Return<!----></span><br>Constant pool (size = 2)<span class="line"><!---->Constant pool (size = 2)<!----></span><br>0x7ef5082d34ad: [FixedArray] in OldSpace<span class="line"><!---->0x7ef5082d34ad: [FixedArray] in OldSpace<!----></span><br> - map: 0x7ef508042201 <Map><span class="line"><!----> - map: 0x7ef508042201 &lt;Map&gt;<!----></span><br> - length: 2<span class="line"><!----> - length: 2<!----></span><br> 0: 0x7ef50824a14d <String[7]: #console><span class="line"><!----> 0: 0x7ef50824a14d &lt;String[7]: #console&gt;<!----></span><br> 1: 0x7ef50824a1c1 <String[3]: #log><span class="line"><!----> 1: 0x7ef50824a1c1 &lt;String[3]: #log&gt;<!----></span><br>Handler Table (size = 0)<span class="line"><!---->Handler Table (size = 0)<!----></span><br>Source Position Table (size = 0)<span class="line"><!---->Source Position Table (size = 0)<!----></span><br>1<span class="line"><!---->1<!----></span><br>undefined<span class="line"><!---->undefined<!----></span><br>d8> (function(){})();<span class="line"><!---->d8&gt; (function(){})();<!----></span><br>[generated           Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      yangguo@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1091219484" title="yangguo@chromium.org"><!---->yangguo@chromium.org<!----></a>
      yangguo@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->yangguo@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 5, 2021, 12:45 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I'm not entirely sure whether we could rule out RCE if we have a type confusion where V8 might misinterpret an object in the constant pool. E.g. if a SharedFunctionInfo is misinterpreted as an ArrayBuffer. In that case I can imagine that an attacker could overwrite the function pointer to something arbitrary.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not entirely sure whether we could rule out RCE if we have a type confusion where V8 might misinterpret an object in the constant pool. E.g. if a SharedFunctionInfo is misinterpreted as an ArrayBuffer. In that case I can imagine that an attacker could overwrite the function pointer to something arbitrary.<!----></span><br><br>I still think the most cautious action is to disable LiveEdit.<span class="line"><!---->I still think the most cautious action is to disable LiveEdit.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161459#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 27, 2022, 5:32 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          yangguo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          yangguo@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Live edit isn't really implemented in the "interpreter" as such the interpreter just executes whatever bytecode it's given and if that's invalid, it's invalid. Liveedit is a separate tree/graph walk of post-compilation, mid-execution state that's currently sitting, afaict, somewhat unowned in the codebase. If we're worried about its security we should audit and harden it, but it's not clear who would own doing that. Assigning to yang for now for lack of a better owner.<span class="line"><!---->Live edit isn't really implemented in the "interpreter" as such the interpreter just executes whatever bytecode it's given and if that's invalid, it's invalid. Liveedit is a separate tree/graph walk of post-compilation, mid-execution state that's currently sitting, afaict, somewhat unowned in the codebase. If we're worried about its security we should audit and harden it, but it's not clear who would own doing that. Assigning to yang for now for lack of a better owner.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
